intro: Cullumia sublanata, commonly known as the woolly cullumia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Cullumia sublanata is adapted to arid environments and is a member of the Ericaceae family.
